website_summaries.verdict: The Sony Carl Zeiss Sonnar T* FE 35mm F2.8 ZA is a compact, sharp wide-angle lens for Sony full-frame mirrorless cameras, but it's on the pricey side.

customer_reviews.title: I love this lens!
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is good though distortion is visible with regards slight fisheye. It is highly versatile though and autofocus on A7r3 works quickly and efficiently with this. Not up to the standard of the 55mm prime say, but for the price, this is a must-have as far as I am concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Pure truth seeker

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy Sony at Amazon if you want to claim cashback
customer_reviews.text: My cashback claim was rejected by Sony as Amazon does not participate. Despite this Amazon was the same price as WEX, Parks etc. So I lost £100. Thanks Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to your A7 family
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Lens, great depth of field and tiny in size. I can't recommend this enough. I have attached a photo of the best stars available to see with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: S. Skeldon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lens
customer_reviews.text: Small, expensive, detailed, impressive. You can see an example shot here: 500px.com/photo/69700203 Clarity for portraits is impressive - works well for closer candid shots of kids etc. Excellent sharpness for all purposes. For walking and photographing I will carry just this lens, the Sony A7 and my Tokina 17mm manual focus FD mount. With a tripod, a very tidy compact package.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Beadle

customer_reviews.title: There is no doubt that this is an excellent lens for Sony FE mount
customer_reviews.text: There is no doubt that this is an excellent lens for Sony FE mount. It focusses well and is very sharp. However, I also have a Canon 40mm pancake lens which is about one quarter the price but is also sharp and f/2.8, so this item is not good value. Carl Zeiss think they can sell their name for twice the price of other brands. When Sigma and Tamron get into this market, they may need to think again.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Taylor

customer_reviews.title: A quality lens
customer_reviews.text: Superb quality on my A7R pin sharp at full aperture only the slightest softening in corners which are also pin sharp stopped down to F4. Expensive but a first class lens.
customer_reviews.author: jmlelectro

customer_reviews.title: Light, crisp, fast, marvellous with A7R
customer_reviews.text: I use this on a Sony A7R and the two make fantastic pair. The lens is very compact and the image quality is awesome. Actually much better than my Canon 5D3. Love the lens.
customer_reviews.author: Tuppence

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Lens, but expensive
customer_reviews.text: This lens is good, very lightweight. It would have been a 5-star if it was F2 or cheaper. Clever lenshood that allows you to mount a filter under the hood.
customer_reviews.author: Tobias Olsson

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive for what you get (I think).
customer_reviews.text: The lens is fine and very small. However the price is just too high for what you are getting, in my personal opinion. I have bought and owned lenses (and cameras) well in excess of the price of this lens, but couldn't shake my view that this just wasn't value for money.
customer_reviews.author: D. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens but no way near as good as the Zeiss 55mm 1.8
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Sony fails to honour its promises.
customer_reviews.text: Sony refuses to honour the £80 cashback campaign for this lens. I purchased this lens on 18 June from amazon.co.uk and submitted my claim on 18 July. This meets all the terms and conditions for the campaign. However, my claim was rejected because, according to Sony "It appears that the date of purchase is the 21st of May while the claim was submitted on the 19th of June." They have made up false dates as a spurious reason to reject the claim. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: jeke

customer_reviews.title: Decent, small, manual focus mode doesn't feel right
customer_reviews.text: I think it's an ok lens, probably the best auto-focus lens out there for the sony alpha series, but I prefer the sharpness and the rendering of adapted Leica-m lenses. The focus ring is not mechanically connected to the elements. I knew this before i bought it, but i held hope that the electric focusing system would work better, but it's inadequate at best and very laggy.
customer_reviews.author: The Blue Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: It's small, it's Zeiss, and it performs. There are only two problems you might have with it: - it's only f2.8 (there are brighter lenses out there, but those are more expensive and generally much larger) - it has a funky hood. First off, mine separated into two parts, but I just glued it back together. The next possible problem is that the filter size of this hood is tiny, and you can't use the built-in filter threads of the lens while the hood is on. I've had it since the beginning with my A7S and NEX-7, and had zero issues with it other than the hood.
customer_reviews.author: Nagy Balazs Andras

product_meta.title: Sony SEL35F28Z E Mount Full Frame Sonar T 35 mm F2.8 Zeiss Prime Lens - Black
product_meta.description:
Sony SEL35F28Z E Mount Full Frame Sonar T 35 mm F2.8 Zeiss Prime Lens - Black.

BOX CONTAINS
Lens hood (ALC-SH129: cap type), Lens front cap and Lens rear cap
feature_bullets: ZEISS T* anti-reflective coating minimises flare
Circular 7-blade aperture for beautiful defocus effects

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars85 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
